public static java.util.Date getDay1AD()
Gets the first date after Christ, 1 January of Year 1 (0001-01-01).

Returns:
Returns a date with value 0001-01-01.

removeTime

public static void removeTime(java.util.Calendar cal)
removes time from a calendar. The calendar remains with the same date and time set to 00:00:00.000

Parameters:
cal - calendar object who's time is removed.

removeTime

public static void removeTime(java.util.Date date)
removes time from a date. The date remains with the same date and time set to 00:00:00.000

Parameters:
date - Date who's time is removed.

isZero

public static boolean isZero(java.util.Date dt)
Shows if a date equals 1/1/0001.

Parameters:
dt - date.
Returns:
returns true is date equals 1/1/0001.

Parameters:
cal - calendar.
Returns:
returns true is date equals 1/1/0001.

difDays

public static int difDays(java.util.Calendar fromDate,
                          java.util.Calendar toDate)
Gets the time passed between two dates in days. The time is counted in days, months or years, according to the parameter type specified. The first parameter fromDate must be less or equal than the second parameter toDate. Otherwise the method will return 0.

Parameters:
fromDate -
toDate -
Returns:
Returns the time passed from fromDate until toDate

addDays

public static java.util.Date addDays(java.util.Date datein,
                                     int days)
Adds days to a date. The parameter days can be negative. In this case the result will be a date before the input parameter datein.

Parameters:
datein -
days -
Returns:
result date

addYears

                                      int years)
Adds years to a date. The parameter years can be negative. In this case the result will be a date before the input parameter datein.

Parameters:
datein -
years -
Returns:
result date as string

getDate

public static java.util.Date getDate(java.lang.Object dt)
                              throws java.text.ParseException
Gets a date from the parameter dt. If dt is a date type (Calendar, Timestamp etc) it will be converted to a Date object. Otherwise the result of the objects toString() will be converted to date according to the system locale.

Parameters:
dt - object representing a date.
Returns:
Returns a date for this object.
Throws:
java.text.ParseException

formatDate

public static java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Date dt)
Creates a formatted string from a Date. The formatted string is based on the short date format specified by Bo2UtilsEnvironment.getDfShort().

Parameters:
dt - Date to format.
Returns:
Returns a formatted string for this date.

formatDateIso

public static java.lang.String formatDateIso(java.util.Date dt)
Creates a formatted string from a Date. The formatted string is based on the ISO date format specified by Bo2UtilsEnvironment.getDfIso().

Parameters:
dt - Date to format.
Returns:
Returns a formatted string for this date.

formatCalendar

public static java.lang.String formatCalendar(java.util.Calendar cal)
Creates a formatted string from a Date. The formatted string is based on the long date format specified by Bo2UtilsEnvironment.getDfLong().

Parameters:
cal - Date to format.
Returns:
Returns a formatted string for this date.
